oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Irlene Mandrell and Louise Mandrell - Parts 4 and 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Louise Mandrell (performer) and Irlene Mandrell (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 4 and 5. Recording is from April 10, 1984.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Irlene Mandrell; Louise Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:02) Ralph Emery introduces Louise Mandrell and Irlene Mandrell, and Emery inquires about any upcoming projects -- (04:33) Emery inquires about which instruments Louise plays and if she continues to perform White Rain commercials -- (06:38) Emery invites Irlene and Louise to discuss "Fire in His Eyes" -- (08:02) Emery inquires if the sisters had heard of Bill Medley and "I Still Do" -- (08:32) Emery reveals that Willie Nelson was about to dub over some Hank Williams recordings -- (09:29) Emery inquires whether or not Louise had performed the fiddle on one of her tracks -- (10:51) Emery inquires about the sister's family dynamic -- (11:50) Emery encourages Irlene to talk about her struggle to stop smoking and Louise's attempt to quit chocolate -- (14:00) Emery inquires about the endeavors of Mary Mandrell -- (14:45) Louise praises the efforts of Buddy Killen "Reunited" -- (15:39) Emery says goodbye to the Mandrell sisters and the audience -- (16:15) Emery introduces Louise and Irlene -- (16:43) Emery invites Louise to discuss "This Beds Not Big Enough -- (18:12) Emery questions why Louise chose to enter the game market with The Louise Mandrell Trivia game -- (20:32) Emery tells Irlene that he often has his guest talk about their childhood and asks Irlene to recall one -- (23:39) Irlene recalls working for Waylon Jennings for the Waylon Jennings Greatest Hits album -- (25:03) Emery has Louise and Irlene recall how they would go along with Barbara Mandrell on her dates -- (27:29) Louise shy's away from Emery's introduction of "Goodbye Heartache" -- (28:03) Emery inquires about Louise's modeling career and Louise's high energy -- (30:11) Emery inquires Irlene about her modeling career -- (31:05) Emery, Louise, and Irlene discuss if they have ever been asked to pose in risque scenes -- (31:55) Emery inquires whether or not the Mandrell Show was still in circulation -- (32:54) Emery expresses his thanks and gives his guarantee of future endeavors; Irlene inquires about whether or not she was invited to go to Aspen -- (34:12) Emery, Irlene, and Louise say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Mandrell, Irlene; Mandrell, Louise;
